snippet: After five years of abundant precipitation, California has received 75 percent of the normal precipitation in the Northern Sierra and less than 25 percent of normal in the Southern Sierra, the state's chief climatologist, Bill Mork, said this week...
lead_paragraph: After five years of abundant precipitation, California has received 75 percent of the normal precipitation in the Northern Sierra and less than 25 percent of normal in the Southern Sierra, the state's chief climatologist, Bill Mork, said this week. ''Up and down the Sierra, we're about 30 percent of average for this time of year,'' Mr. Mork said.
abstract: California farmers are nervous as scientists say La Nina will mean another drier than usual winter; if dry spell stretches through December, there is 25 percent chance state will experience so-called critical dry year (M)

headline.main: Dry Spell Has California Farmers Watching the Sky, and Hoping
